{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.05130v1", "title": "Viscous pressureless flows with free boundary in one space dimension:
  The constant viscosity case", "summary": "We establish the global well-posedness of the free boundary problem of the
viscous pressureless and almost pressureless heat conductive flows in one space
dimension. In both cases, arbitrarily large but smooth initial data is
considered, and the evolving fluid domains remain bounded for all time. In the
viscous pressureless case, we are able to identify the terminal flow domain in
terms of the initial data. In the viscous almost pressureless case, we
construct the flow as a perturbation of the viscous pressureless flow, and
establish the first result for the Navier-Stokes-Fourier system in the current
setting.", "main_category": "math.AP", "categories": "math.AP", "published": "2025-04-07T14:33:33Z"}
